Wisdom: ارْفِضُوا هَذِهِ الدُّنْيَا ذَمِيمَةً فَقَدْ رَفَضَتْ مَنْ كَانَ أَشْعَفَ بِهَا مِنْكُمْ
enWisdom: Reject this world as a dispraised thing, for it has rejected one who loves it more passionately than you

Wisdom: اهْرُبُوا مِنَ الدُّنْيَا وَاصْرِفُوا قُلُوبَكُمْ عَنْهَا فَإِنَّهَا سِجْنُ الْمُؤْمِنِ حَظُّهُ مِنْهَا قَلِيلٌ وَعَقْلُهُ بِهَا عَلِيلٌ وَنَاظِرُهُ فِيهَا كَلِيلٌ
enWisdom: Flee from this world and divert your hearts from it, for it is the prison of a believer his share of it is little and his mind is sickened by it and his sight is dulled in it

Wisdom: ارْفُضُوا هَذِهِ الدُّنْيَا التَّارِكَةَ لَكُمْ وَإِنْ لَمْ تُحِبُّوا تَرْكَهَا وَالْمُبْلِيَةَ أَجْسَادَكُمْ عَلَى مَحَبَّتِكُمْ لِتَجْدِيدِهَا
enWisdom: Reject this world which will [shortly] abandon you even if you do not like to leave it, and which will make your bodies [grow] old even if you would like to have them rejuvenated

Wisdom: احْذَرُوا الزَّائِلَ الشَّهِيَّ وَالْفَانِيَ الْمَحْبُوبَ [احْذَرِ الزَّائِلَ الشَّهِيَّ الْفَانِيَ وَالْمَحْبُوبَ‏]
enWisdom: Be cautious of the vanishing desirable and the perishing beloved

Wisdom: احْذَرِ الدُّنْيَا فَإِنَّهَا شَبَكَةُ الشَّيْطَانِ وَمَفْسَدَةُ الْإِيمَانِ
enWisdom: Be cautious of this world, for it is the net of the devil and the [place of] corruption of faith
The best garment (or better than wearing the garment) of this world is renouncing it

Wisdom: رَحِمَ اللَّهُ امْرَأً غَالَبَ الْهَوَى وَأَفْلَتَ مِنْ حَبَائِلِ الدُّنْيَا
enWisdom: May Allah have mercy upon the person who fights his vain desire and breaks loose from the entanglements of this world

Wisdom: رُبَّ مَحْذُورٍ مِنَ الدُّنْيَا عِنْدَكَ غَيْرُ مُحْتَسَبٍ
enWisdom: Many a thing which one should be cautious of in this world is not taken into consideration by you

Wisdom: كُنْ آنَسَ مَا تَكُونُ بِالدُّنْيَا أَحْذَرَ مَا تَكُونُ مِنْهَا
enWisdom: Be most cautious of this world when you are most at ease with it

Wisdom: مَنْ أَحَبَّ رِفْعَةَ الدُّنْيَا وَالْآخِرَةِ فَلْيَمْقُتْ فِي الدُّنْيَا الرِّفْعَةَ
enWisdom: One who loves [to acquire] the prestige of [both] this world and the Hereafter must detest prestige in this world
The basis of God-wariness is rejection of this world

Wisdom: لَا تَيْأَسْ مِنَ الزَّمَانِ إِذَا مَنَعَ وَلَا تَثِقْ بِهِ إِذَا أَعْطَى وَكُنْ مِنْهُ عَلَى أَعْظَمِ الْحَذَرِ
enWisdom: Do not lose hope in time when it withholds, and do not rely upon it when it gives, and always be extremely cautious of it
